statement: “The CDC is about to add the COVID vaccine to the childhood immunization schedule, which would make the vax mandatory for kids to attend school.”
label: barely-true
justification: An advisory committee to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention voted in favor of adding COVID-19 vaccines to the CDC’s recommended, routine immunization schedule for adults and children. That schedule is not a mandate.States establish vaccination requirements for attending school or daycare, not the CDC.State officials consider the CDC advisory committee’s recommendations when setting vaccine requirements, but experts said no state follows CDC recommendations to the letter.

statement: “Mandela Barnes came out in favor of abortion up until the moment of birth.”
label: barely-true
justification: The National Republican Senatorial Committee’s backup for the claim relies heavily on Barnes’ comments about codifying Roe v. Wade — not abortion up until the moment of birth.For his part, Barnes had not been entirely clear on his position on this question — until we pushed his campaign to be more precise.In any case, there has not been any recent change, as the claim suggests, much less one with this level of specificity.

statement: Electric vehicles are unaffordable because “the average cost of replacing an electric vehicle battery is over $10,000, while the average cost of replacing the battery of a gas-powered car is $100 to $200.”
label: barely-true
justification: The cost of electric vehicle batteries varies widely, but $10,000 is a mid-range price, compared with the cost of $100 to $200 for a battery in a gas-powered vehicle.The two types of batteries play totally different roles under the hood of a car. A traditional battery simply starts the car engine, while the battery for an electric vehicle stores all the power needed for moving the vehicle.Early studies have found that over a car’s lifetime, consumers save money with electric vehicles because of lower fuel and maintenance costs.

statement: In Texas, a person can register a dead relative to vote and then cast a mail ballot in their name.
label: barely-true
justification: When Texans submit a voter registration application, their name, birth date, driver’s license number or four digits of their Social Security number are compared with records from the Texas Department of Public Safety and Social Security Administration. That process would flag an application on a dead person’s behalf.The Texas secretary of state receives information regarding people who have died weekly, or monthly, depending upon the data. That information is immediately forwarded to county voter registrars so that they can remove those individuals from their voter rolls.County officials remove thousands of dead people from the voter rolls each month.

statement: Says “Tim Michels wants to defund public education — calling it ‘the definition of insanity’ to continue to fund public schools.”
label: barely-true
justification: At a July 2022 primary debate, Michels said it was the “definition of insanity” to continually increase funding to public schools without better results. The campaign’s quote makes it seem as though he said it was insane to continue funding them at all, which is wrong.However, as a proponent of school choice expansion, Michels could oversee changes that result in cuts to public education.School vouchers are already funded by cutting state aid to school districts. If Michels increases the number of students who use vouchers and doesn’t otherwise increase funding to public education, that will cut funding for public schools — unless he chooses to fund the expansion in another way.

statement: As attorney general, Catherine Cortez Masto “opposed tougher laws on methamphetamine dealers.”
label: barely-true
justification: As attorney general, now-Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto chaired the Governor’s Working Group on Methamphetamine Use in Nevada.The group opposed two bills that would increase penalties for meth possession.The group supported other bills and initiatives to mitigate Nevada’s meth crisis. Cortez Masto also opposed reducing sentences for immigrants who were illegally in the country and were convicted of meth trafficking.

statement: A study showed mRNA COVID-19 vaccines are harmful to infants who are breastfeeding.
label: barely-true
justification: A study of 11 breastfeeding women who had recently been vaccinated found traces of mRNA COVID-19 vaccines in breast milk samples from five of the participants up to 45 hours after vaccination.Researchers recommended further study, but concluded that “it is safe to breastfeed after maternal COVID-19 vaccination.”They said that until further studies are done “caution is warranted” when breastfeeding children younger than 6 months in the first 48 hours after maternal vaccination.

statement: “Katie Hobbs voted for allowing a baby who survives an abortion — that the hospital would refuse medical care and allow the baby to die on a cold metal tray.”
label: barely-true
justification: An Arizona law requires doctors to provide life-saving care to babies that survive an abortion, unless they determine there is no chance of survival.Democratic gubernatorial candidate Katie Hobbs opposed the bill in 2017.The bill’s passage had no effect on the legal or ethical requirement for doctors to provide care for infants that survive an abortion.

statement: Says Tony Evers is “a career politician.”
label: barely-true
justification: Gov. Evers began his career as a teacher in Wisconsin in 1974.Evers entered partisan politics in 2018 when he ran for governor,  defeating Republican incumbent Scott Walker.He was previously elected state superintendent, a nonpartisan position,  in 2009, and re-elected in 2013 and 2017.

statement: "$12 billion more for Ukraine on top of $100+ billion while Jackson, Mississippi has yet to receive any funding to fix their water infrastructure."
label: barely-true
justification: When the Instagram post was shared, Congress was considering legislation that included $20 million in funding for Jackson, Mississippi’s water infrastructure. The legislation passed Sept. 30.Much more funding will be needed to completely address the problems in Jackson.

statement: Pennsylvania Senate candidate John Fetterman’s tattoo references ‘heroin use’ and the Crips
label: barely-true
justification: Pennsylvania Senate candidate John Fetterman has a tattoo on his left arm that reads “15104,” the ZIP code for Braddock, Pennsylvania, where he was mayor from 2006 to 2019. On his right arm, there are at least nine tattoos that list numeric dates memorializing Braddock residents who were victims of violent crime during his time in office.In a 2008 interview, Fetterman said the tattoos on his right arm served as a “permanent reminder” of those who met “violent ends” during his mayoral tenure. He made similar comments in 2009 and 2022. Fetterman’s campaign told PolitiFact the tattoos have nothing to do with heroin use and are not an homage to any gang.Fetterman used to have a tattoo on the outside of his right wrist that read, “I will make you hurt.” It’s a lyric from a popular song that refers to needle use. But in a 2009 interview, Fetterman connected that sentiment with the deaths recorded on the other side of his arm.

statement: Lee County, Florida, wasn't "even in the cone" of Hurricane Ian 72 hours before landfall.
label: barely-true
justification: Most of Lee County, Florida, was not within the forecast cone of Hurricane Ian 72 hours before landfall. But one of the county's barrier islands, Cayo Costa, appeared inside the forecast cone on each of the eight advisories issued by the National Hurricane Center on Sept. 25, three days before the storm.The forecast cone visual is meant to show the probable track of the center of the storm, not the extent of a hurricane's reach. Focusing on the forecast cone downplays the impacts of a storm as large as Ian, said Matt Rogers, an atmospheric science researcher at Colorado State University.Still, in Ian's case, the cone was an accurate forecast of the storm's eventual trajectory, Rogers said. The hurricane ultimately made landfall in Cayo Costa.

statement: Raphael Warnock "called police thugs, then cut their funding."
label: barely-true
justification: • Warnock used the word “thugs” in a 2015 sermon. He was specifically referring to police in Ferguson, Missouri, not police generally.• As a senator, Warnock sponsored a bill to help small police departments hire and keep officers. He also voted for the American Rescue Plan, which provided billions of dollars to states and local jurisdictions to invest in police departments and other efforts to secure communities.

statement: Michigan’s Proposal 2 “will permanently put in the Constitution that you never have to show an ID to vote ever again.”
label: barely-true
justification: This fall, Michigan voters will be asked to consider Proposal 2, which would change voting protections in the state’s constitution.The proposal would not eliminate the state’s existing requirement that voters show a photo ID before casting a ballot in person. Voters will still be asked to show a poll worker picture identification before they receive a ballot.People who do not have a photo ID or do not have it with them will also still be allowed to vote if they sign an affidavit, which is a type of sworn written statement, verifying their identity.

statement: "Only 325,000 American kids out of 19,000,000" were vaccinated against COVID-19.
label: barely-true
justification: In the United States, about 30 million children ages 6 months to 17 years old have received at least one COVID-19 vaccine dose, according to data from the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.More than 20 million kids ages 5 to 17 have completed their primary vaccine series.About 325,000children ages 6 months to 4 years old were fully vaccinated as of mid-September. And U.S. Census Bureau data showed that there were about 18.8 million children younger than 5 in the U.S. as of July 1, 2021.

statement: Adam Laxalt took “campaign cash” from drug companies “and used his office to block local attempts at holding one of the worst offenders accountable.”
label: barely-true
justification: Adam Laxalt received $20,250 in campaign donations from drug companies between 2014 and 2018.As attorney general, Laxalt opposed a plan from Reno’s mayor to independently sue drug companies, saying it could affect a multistate investigation that involved Nevada. But when the city ultimately sued the companies, Laxalt supported the move.Laxalt also sued Purdue Pharma in May 2018, alleging that the drug company deceived Nevadans about prescription opioids.

statement: “Lifeguard/football player Joe Biden got five draft deferments for asthma during Vietnam.”
label: barely-true
justification: President Joe Biden did receive five draft deferments, but they were granted because he was a student, first in college and then law school.Later, Biden underwent a physical exam and received a Selective Service 1-Y classification — which specified that he could be drafted only in a national emergency — because of his asthma.

statement: The World Economic Forum has called for the end of “wasteful private car ownership.”
label: barely-true
justification: A report by the World Economic Forum detailed ways society could address the growing scarcity of metals used in green energy technologies, including using car-sharing instead of private car ownership.The organization never advocated for ending private car ownership and never called it “wasteful.”

statement: With Apple’s NameDrop, anyone placing an iPhone near your child’s “will automatically receive their contact information.”
label: false
justification: Apple’s new NameDrop feature, available in iPhones using iOS17.1 and Apple Watches using watchOS 10.1, allows two users to quickly share contact information by tapping and holding their phones close together.The contact sharing doesn’t happen automatically, however, if a stranger simply puts his or her phone too close to yours.Both phones must be unlocked, and each user must choose whether to send or receive information, or both. They must also choose what information to share.

statement: “In Germany, you must be fully vaxxed before your death by assisted suicide.”
label: false
justification: Germany has no policy requiring vaccination before assisted suicide.The post linked to a November 2021 story that referred to a German euthanasia assistance advocacy group’s directive that its members be vaccinated or have recovered from a COVID-19 infection. That rule was made to protect doctors, staff and other members from infection, the group’s website said.The organization, Verein Sterbehlife, no longer lists that directive on its website.

statement: John D. Rockefeller wrote a secret covenant about controlling the world’s population.
label: false
justification: This "secret covenant" emerged online in 2002 on a financial website written by an anonymous author.We found no credible information linking this statement to John D. Rockefeller.Rockefeller, one of the world’s first billionaires, and his family are frequent targets of conspiracy theories.

statement: "MSNBC airs Gaza 'crisis actor.'"
label: false
justification: The man Newsmax called a "crisis actor" is a social media influencer who has been posting about Gaza and the al-Shifa Hospital.

statement: Suggests homeless people mysteriously went missing in San Francisco.
label: false
justification: The Department of Homeland Security designated the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit in San Francisco, attended by President Joe Biden and President Xi Jinping of China, as a special security event, which restricted access for some geographic areas of the city.San Francisco officials moved some of the city’s homeless population into shelters before the summit.Other homeless people moved to alleys and under a freeway, advocates for homeless people said.

statement: “8 MINUTES AGO! The largest underwater volcano has SUDDENLY CRACKED OPEN the Earth!”
label: false
justification: The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha’apai underwater volcano did erupt, but it was in January 2022, not recently.

statement: Video showing “Israeli occupation forces arrest a 2-year-old child” is from the Israel-Hamas war.
label: false
justification: A video showing Israeli border police briefly detaining a young Palestinian boy was filmed in 2018 and is not related to the current Israel-Hamas war.

statement: Pizzagate “expert” went to jail for child pornography
label: false
justification: Former ABC News investigative journalist James Gordon Meek was sentenced in September to six years in federal prison for possessing and transporting child sexual abuse images.Meek never debunked the Pizzagate conspiracy theory. He mentioned the theory once in an article about Russian propaganda in Syria.

statement: Video shows Black Friday shoppers “in Biden’s thriving economy.”
label: false
justification: Footage of a lone shopper entering a store on Black Friday was filmed in London in 2017.The National Retail Federation said a record 200.4 million people shopped in person or online in the U.S. over the five-day Thanksgiving weekend.

statement: Iceland has banned COVID-19 vaccines “amid soaring sudden deaths.”
label: false
justification: Iceland’s health authority said the country has not banned COVID-19 vaccines and there hasn’t been a rise in deaths caused by the inoculation.The Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines are available in Iceland, the country’s health authority said.

statement: Video of an Alabama compound shows “Hamas is here and training hidden in plain sight.”
label: false
justification: The television news story featured in the post first aired in May 2019. The Alabama training compound featured in the piece was linked to a group that was charged in relation to a terrorism plot, but that the group was not related to Hamas.The U.S. Attorney’s Office for the District of New Mexico, where the group had another compound, told PolitiFact there was "no indication" the group had ties to Hamas.

statement: "Ataque terrorista islámico confirmado cerca de la frontera con Canadá en el puente del Arco Iris en las cataratas del Niágara".
label: false
justification: El Buró Federal de Investigaciones de Estados Unidos (FBI, por sus siglas en inglés) dijo que el accidente del 22 de noviembre no fue un ataque terrorista.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: "The U.S. is sending everyone a free $6,400 right now.”
label: false
justification: The U.S. government has not announced it’s sending everyone $6,400.The link included in the post is not affiliated with the federal government.

statement: Clips of Nikki Haley speaking about Hillary Clinton show Haley supports Clinton and is “not who she says she is.”
label: false
justification: An ad from a Ron DeSantis political action committee misleadingly clips and edits Nikki Haley’s comments about Hillary Clinton, leaving viewers with the impression that she is a Clinton fan.Haley has said that she ran for office in 2004 after listening to Clinton give a keynote address encouraging women to run for office.The ad misleadingly edits out Haley’s repeated caveat that she disagrees politically with Clinton.

statement: A “brand new financial relief program available for Americans" provides $5,000 in cash.
label: false
justification: The post links to a website that says it collects personal information to connect users with lenders.The site asks for bank account and Social Security numbers.

statement: Audio shows former President Donald Trump warned “300 million Americans” will die from a catastrophe “in a matter of weeks.”
label: false
justification: We could not identify the source for the audio contained in these videos, which also appeared as paid ads on Meta.Former President Donald Trump is not on record endorsing the Teddy Daniels documentary that is promoted in these videos. Nor do we find any published evidence that he issued these warnings.While the audio is reminiscent of Trump’s voice, it does not match the cadence of his natural speaking voice. Experts told us AI-detection analysis was not conclusive as to whether the audio was electronically generated.

statement: “Fox News got caught” staging a video of Israel arresting a “crisis actor.”
label: false
justification: Raw footage shared by Fox News reporter Trey Yingst shows a Palestinian man undressing before Israeli forces arrested him in Gaza.A Fox News report showed the arrest of the man clad only in underwear followed by footage that captured him removing his pants before the arrest. A Fox News spokesperson said inclusion of the later footage resulted from an editing oversight.

statement: Desaparece “una niña de 4 años” en baño de Disneyland en octubre de 2023.
label: false
justification: No hay evidencia de que una niña haya desaparecido por un túnel secreto en Disneyland en California.La policía de Anaheim, California, donde el parque está situado, dijo que no está investigando un secuestro infantil en Disneyland.Un portavoz del equipo de relaciones de medios del Disneyland Resort le dijo a PolitiFact que la afirmación en el video es un rumor falso.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: "Trump has selected his pick for running mate (and the) news stuns Republican Party.”
label: false
justification: Former President Donald Trump has not announced a running mate.

statement: "You’re in danger” because the American Red Cross doesn’t label blood donations from donors vaccinated against COVID-19.
label: false
justification: There is no danger from blood transfusions that include blood from COVID-19 vaccinated donors, health experts said.Vaccine components are not found in the bloodstream, an American Red Cross spokesperson said.

statement: Video shows a military chaplain praying, “Please get rid of Joe Biden and bring back the real president, Donald J. Trump.”
label: false
justification: The video’s audio was edited. The military chaplain did not pray to "get rid of" President Joe Biden and "bring back" Donald Trump.The video clip comes from footage of a Thanksgiving event the Bidens held Nov. 19 for military service members and their families.The military chaplain mentioned neither Biden nor Trump during his prayer.

statement: "La industria alimentaria quiere que comas” lechuga de plástico sintético sin nutrición y lleno de contaminantes.
label: false
justification: El video en Facebook muestra a una persona creando lechugas falsas para mostrarlas en menús de restaurantes japoneses.Las muestras no se venden  para el consumo humano.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Video shows a Doctors Without Borders medic in Jenin taking a weapon from a wounded person and giving it to someone else.
label: false
justification: A Doctors Without Borders spokesperson told PolitiFact that the man wearing an orange vest in the video is not affiliated with the organization. Doctors Without Borders staff members wear white vests with the organization’s red logo.The orange vest matches ones worn by Palestinian Medical Relief Society members, The Associated Press and Lead Stories reported. Photos from The Associated Press, Getty Images and the Palestinian Medical Relief Society’s Facebook page also show vests in use that resemble the one worn by the man in the video.The Instagram post claims the video shows a medic in a West Bank combat zone, but Doctors Without Borders said its Jenin-based staff do not treat people outside on the streets.

statement: “Terrorist attack confirmed” in Niagara Falls, New York.
label: false
justification: The FBI said the Nov. 22 crash had no links to terrorist activity. The case has been turned over to the Niagara Falls Police Department as a traffic investigation.

statement: Video shows teacher teaching gender pronouns and being confronted by students
label: false
justification: This clip shows a skit created by Jibrizy, an online video creator who says he makes videos to "start discussion."The original clip has a disclaimer at the end that it is scripted, but that is edited out from the version being shared.Jibrizy’s videos depicting fake confrontations over LGBTQ+ issues havegone viralbefore without context.

statement: Videos of Nancy Pelosi from Jan. 6, 2021, show the Capitol attack was staged.
label: false
justification: This footage from Jan. 6, 2021, shows then-House Speaker Nancy Pelosi speaking with then-Vice President Mike Pence about when Congress would be able to reconvene to finish certifying the 2020 election results.There are copious news reports and video and audio recordings showing that the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol was not staged. It was a real event with real consequences. More than 1,100 people have been charged with federal crimes related to the attack.

statement: “Israel has changed their barcode from 729 to 871 … as the public was boycotting Israeli products.”
label: false
justification: Bar codes are traded all over the world among companies and the codes are not a conclusive way to determine a product’s country of origin.Bar code prefixes are assigned based on the location of the companies that request them, the organization that standardizes bar codes said. But they should not be used to identify where a product was made.The number "729" is assigned to Israel but a product with that code doesn’t mean it was made in Israel. The number "871" is already assigned to the Netherlands.

statement: Video shows that “Troy Nehls FORCES Pete Buttigieg to admit that Biden is unfit to serve.”
label: false
justification: The video does not show that. During the exchange with Rep. Troy Nehls, R-Texas, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg called President Joe Biden a "vigorous" boss.

statement: “New police bodycam footage” of George Floyd’s arrest “changes the narrative”
label: false
justification: This body camera footage has been publicly available since August 2020, two months after George Floyd’s death.The footage was shown to the jury during former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin’s trial in March 2021. The jury found Chauvin guilty of second-degree murder.The officer, whose body camera footage Kelly showed, pleaded guilty to second-degree manslaughter in May 2022.

statement: A "ghost bus … filled with FBI informants dressed as Trump supporters deployed onto our Capitol on January 6th.”
label: false
justification: Hundreds of rioters, many wearing Trump-branded apparel, stormed the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.Experts said they were unfamiliar with the term "ghost bus" and that there are reasons the FBI would not bus a group of informants to an event.FBI Director Christopher Wray testified Nov. 15 that the agency’s sources and agents were not responsible for violence at the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.

statement: Jim Justice “broke his pledge, raised the gas tax.”
label: false
justification: Justice signed an increase in gasoline taxes and other motor vehicle taxes and fees, and he also signed a pledge not to raise taxes.However, Justice signed the gasoline tax increase in 2017, about six years before he signed the taxpayer protection pledge. He couldn’t have broken a pledge he hadn’t signed yet.Justice also signed an income tax cut in 2023 that was widely described as the largest in West Virginia history.Learn more aboutPolitiFact’s fact-checking process and rating system.

statement: The federal government and the Federal Reserve were “raising inflation,” something that “had nothing to do with … getting our economy back in line” but rather to fund a “war against a bunch of civilians.”
label: false
justification: Although government policy may have exacerbated inflation, which peaked recently in summer 2022, economists say coronavirus pandemic-related supply chain disruptions and price shocks from Russia’s invasion of Ukraine drove up inflation primarily.The Federal Reserve has targeted interest rate increases to lower inflation and succeeded.Hamas’ surprise terrorist attacks Oct. 7 precipitated the war in Gaza. These occurred on Hamas’ own timetable, and happened when inflation in the U.S. had cooled to near-the Fed’s 3% target level.

statement: Video shows Israeli soldiers “raising their flag” over al-Shifa hospital in Gaza.
label: false
justification: The video was not taken in al-Shifa hospital, but at a nearby building.A journalist using satellite imagery to find where the video was shot found that it showed the Gaza Preliminary School for Boys. We verified the location by using Google Earth imagery and identifying matching features from the video. ​

statement: CNN and The Associated Press “admitted” to knowing about Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack in advance but didn’t tell anyone.
label: false
justification: There is no evidence that CNN, The Associated Press or other major news organizations knew in advance about Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack on Israel.Both news organizations rejected the claims and said photographs from freelance journalists documenting the event were filed an hour or more after it began.

statement: “Any American who needs $2,000 a month can get it now” thanks to a new government program.
label: false
justification: An IRS spokesperson told PolitiFact that a legitimate government check will never have the IRS as the payer, the way the check shown in the Facebook post does.

statement: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis “did something six months ago” akin to Nikki Haley recruiting Chinese companies to South Carolina.
label: false
justification: PolitiFact did not find any government reports or news stories that show Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis recruited Chinese companies to the state in the last six months. Other fact-checkers reported similar findings.Experts said that state governments typically have little to no involvement in whether a company expands, as those permits are obtained locally.

statement: Video shows “Elon Musk and the Dubai billionaire have unveiled new software called ‘Quantum AI.’”
label: false
justification: This is unfounded.

statement: “Footage from Israeli helicopter shows the IDF killing many people at October 7 concert in Israel.”
label: false
justification: The Israel Defense Forces posted a video Oct. 9 on X that it said showed the Israeli air force striking Hamas militants following Hamas’ Oct. 7 attacks in Israel.A group that analyzes video locations said the video was not filmed at the site of the Tribe of Nova music festival, where more than 200 people were killed during Hamas’ Oct. 7 attacks in Israel.We found no evidence to support claims that the video clip showed the Israel Defense Forces killing people at an Oct. 7 concert in Israel.

statement: Billboard in New York City shows “Stand with Israel” ad replacing “Stand with Ukraine” ad.
label: false
justification: A video claiming to show a pro-Israel ad replaced a pro-Ukraine ad on a New York City digital billboard is fabricated and didn’t appear there, the company that owns the billboard said.

statement: Video shows President Joe Biden falling “on the plane stairs shortly after landing in Poland.”
label: false
justification: This video doesn’t show President Joe Biden.

statement: "El representante oficial de las fuerzas armadas de Yemen ha declarado oficialmente la guerra a Israel".
label: false
justification: Los hutíes son un grupo rebelde en Yemen que atacó a Israel el 31 de octubre con drones y misiles balísticos.Los hutíes no representan al gobierno oficial de Yemen.Una experta en Yemen de Human Rights Watch confirmó a PolitiFact que Yemen no declaró la guerra a Israel.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Fox News reported that Stormy Daniels admitted having a ‘business relationship’ with Speaker Mike Johnson.
label: false
justification: The post was shared as satire by a self-described parody account.A Fox News spokesperson confirmed that the network never reported on a "business relationship" between Mike Johnson and former adult film actor Stormy Daniels.

statement: Former President Donald Trump “just told everyone he is commander in chief.”
label: false
justification: Former President Donald Trump isn’t the commander in chief, President Joe Biden is. Trump recently referred to his prior experience in the White House relative to the other Republican presidential candidates, none of whom have served as commander in chief.

statement: Photo shows “Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla wearing a mask in November 2023.”
label: false
justification: This photo was taken in November 2020, not 2023.

statement: Rise in U.S. infant mortality rate connected to COVID-19 vaccines.
label: false
justification: The U.S. infant mortality rate rose 3% in 2022, the first year-to-year increase in 20 years, a Nov. 1 report from the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s National Center for Health Statistics shows.The report cited no cause for the increase.Studies have shown no increased risk of pregnancy complications among vaccinated people.

statement: New Hampshire has “a worse drug problem per capita than any other state."
label: false
justification: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports how many people die annually from drug overdoses, per state.Preliminary 2022 data and final 2021 data placed West Virginia at the top of the list.New Hampshire ranks toward the middle of the 50 states.

statement: “Just like the Cuban regime, the Biden administration is trying to put their political opponents in jail, shutting down free speech.”
label: false
justification: Former President Donald Trump’s comparison of his prosecutions with the Cuban regime downplays the realities of the island’s authoritarian regime, experts said.The Cuban government intimidates activists, political opponents and journalists by detaining or arresting them and subjecting them to poor treatment and violence in detention.Trump has been the subject of two gag orders, one in a civil case and one in a criminal case. But neither amounts to the Biden administration broadly shutting down free speech.

statement: “Kids who don’t even know what day it is or their colors can decide to permanently change themselves” through medical gender transition.
label: false
justification: While debating a bill about youth gender transition treatment, Wisconsin Assembly Speaker Robin Vos claimed "kids who don’t even know what day it is or their colors can decide to permanently change themselves."Wisconsin gender care clinics follow professional guidelines that restrict gender transition care for prepubescent children.Medical gender transition treatment options are not available for young, prepubescent children at Wisconsin clinics.

statement: Looking at “American aid to other countries … the vast majority of it is military aid.”
label: false
justification: In 2022, military aid accounted for about 13% of overall U.S. foreign aid.In this century, military aid has consistently accounted for less than 40% of overall foreign aid.

statement: Quotes House Speaker Mike Johnson as saying, “Every woman has a duty to birth at least one able-bodied worker.”
label: false
justification: There is no evidence Speaker Mike Johnson said the quote that is attributed to him in this post.The quote is an inaccurate paraphrase of comments he made about the effect abortion access has had on the economy and the estimated federal benefits from reducing the size of the current population.

statement: On Nov. 7, 2023, Pennsylvania voting machines were “flipping votes,” which is evidence of “election fraud.”
label: false
justification: A clerical error by a voting machine company caused votes in two judicial races to appear switched on printed ballot summaries that were produced after some Northampton County, Pennsylvania, voters cast ballots. Local officials said the machines recorded voters’ choices accurately and all votes were tabulated properly.A spokesperson for Election Systems & Software, the company that made the voting machines, said an employee made the programming error.The Pennsylvania State Department said this error was isolated to the two judicial retention questions in Northampton County. Voters were informed of the issue before casting ballots.

statement: “There is a serial killer in Cincinnati.” Seven bodies were found “chopped up.”
label: false
justification: Cincinnati officials said only one woman has been found dismembered in the city, contrary to social media rumors of a serial killer on the loose in Cincinnati.

statement: New York’s fraud case against Trump “has nothing to do with his home in Mar-a-Lago.”
label: false
justification: In 2022, New York Attorney General Letitia James filed a lawsuit alleging that former President Donald Trump and the Trump Organization "created more than 200 false and misleading valuations of assets" to defraud financial institutions. Trump has denied wrongdoing.In September, a New York Supreme Court judge ruled Trump had inflated his Mar-a-Lago estate’s value.Regardless of Mar-a-Lago’s exact value, the question of whether Trump assets’ values were inflated is central to the New York fraud case.

statement: Video muestra gente en Gaza en 2023 maquillándose heridas.
label: false
justification: El video es de 2017 y muestra un proyecto de la organización no gubernamental Médicos del Mundo en Gaza, donde participaron maquilladores palestinos y donde se buscaba concienciar sobre el peligro al que se enfrentan los habitantes de Gaza.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Video shows Ontario Premier Doug Ford promoting Elon Musk’s “latest project.”
label: false
justification: This video was altered.

statement: Mel Gibson posted about “the end” of Israel and said the country wants “to destroy everything in the way.”
label: false
justification: We found no evidence Mel Gibson made such a statement. His agent has said he wasn’t responsible for it and has no public-facing social media accounts.

statement: Elon Musk is dead.
label: false
justification: This claim is unfounded. X owner Elon Musk is alive.

statement: Video shows TV personalities promoting a diabetes cure.
label: false
justification: These videos were altered.

statement: Videos show singer Kelly Clarkson promoting diet products.
label: false
justification: Videos that appear to show singer Kelly Clarkson promoting diet products are altered. Her publicist has said she’s not a spokesperson for any such products.

statement: “Taylor Swift pulls ‘Eras’ film screenings in Israel.”
label: false
justification: Tickets are still available for screenings of "The Eras Tour" in Israel.

statement: Wisconsin elections administrator Meagan Wolfe “allowed for the use of illegal drop boxes and ballot harvesting.”
label: false
justification: A TV ad claimed Wisconsin Elections Commission administrator Meagan Wolfe allowed illegal absentee ballot drop boxes and ballot harvesting in the 2020 presidential election.However, Wolfe is bound to decisions made by Wisconsin’s bipartisan elections commission.Drop boxes were legally unchallenged in 2020.The ad misrepresents Wolfe’s role as elections administrator.

statement: “Protesters in Kerala India accidentally brought the Italian flag instead of the Palestine flag to pro-Hamas protest.”
label: false
justification: This video shows the flag of the Welfare Party of India, which organized the demonstration — not an Italian flag.

statement: New York Attorney General Letitia James said President Joe Biden “is an embarrassment to all that we stand for.”
label: false
justification: Video footage of New York Attorney General Letitia James shows her criticizing then-President Donald Trump in 2018, not President Joe Biden now.

statement: Video shows late night host Jimmy Fallon interviewing singer Kelly Clarkson about a weight loss product.
label: false
justification: This video was altered.

statement: Video shows California Gov. Gavin Newsom falling down airplane stairs.
label: false
justification: This video doesn’t show California Gov. Gavin Newsom falling down airplane stairs, according to his office. Other news outlets say it shows Sen. Tommy Tuberville years ago.

statement: “Only in Washington can you cut funding, add a pay-for to a new spending measure, and they say it's terrible for the deficit.”
label: false
justification: The Congressional Budget Office’s long-standing practice has been to classify cuts to the IRS’ enforcement budget — which decrease collections — as reducing tax revenue. That means cuts to the agency’s enforcement budget are projected to increase the deficit.Businesses use the same logic when they cut spending on things that generate revenue, budget experts said.

statement: Video shows Hoda Kotb interviewing Kelly Clarkson about “her weight loss journey.”
label: false
justification: This video was altered.

statement: Video shows “Israel Zionist blowing up people in hospitals” in 2023.
label: false
justification: This footage has been online since July 2016. Posts from that time identify the location as Syria.

statement: Photo shows “American soldiers praying for their country, for Israel before being deployed to defend Israel” in 2023.
label: false
justification: This photo is more than 6 years old.U.S. troops have not been deployed to fight in the Israel-Hamas war.

statement: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy “has surrendered.”
label: false
justification: There are no credible reports that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has surrendered to Russia.

statement: Israel bombed Palestinian children trying to get water.
label: false
justification: A video shared online that shows a bomb dropped onto a crowd from above is from a current conflict in Sudan, not the Israel-Hamas war.

statement: Ohio’s Issue 1 “allows for abortion after viability for…financial reasons.”
label: false
justification: Issue 1, an Ohio ballot measure, would codify abortion access in the state’s constitution. It would allow for abortion bans after a fetus is viable, but require exceptions for the mother’s life and health — a standard similar to Roe v. Wade."Financial reasons" are not included as an exception in the amendment, but anti-abortion groups say the term "health" could be interpreted to include finances.Existing legal precedent shows examples of the court widening the definition of "health" beyond just physical, to mental and emotional health, but PolitiFact found no examples of a court including "financial reasons" within its definition.

statement: 1936 in the United States was “much hotter than 2023.”
label: false
justification: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration data shows that in the contiguous U.S., the first nine months of 2023 were 1.64°F warmer than the parallel period in 1936.There’s overwhelming evidence that human-caused climate change is warming the Earth and leading to more intense and frequent heat waves.

statement: Switzerland’s distribution of iodine tablets means the government is worried about nuclear war.
label: false
justification: For years, Switzerland has distributed iodine tablets to residents living within 50 kilometers (31.1 miles) of one of the country’s three nuclear power plants.It last distributed such pills in 2014.Its current distribution doesn’t suggest it’s worried about nuclear war.

statement: Video shows “rioters rush people’s houses” Oct. 28 in Washington D.C.
label: false
justification: This video was filmed in 2020 and shows people invited into someone’s home in Washington, D.C. It does not show protesters in October 2023.

statement: Bill Gates wrote a 2011 article titled “Depopulation Through Forced Vaccination.”
label: false
justification: Microsoft Corp. co-founder and philanthropist Bill Gates didn’t write this article.

statement: “New court documents reveal that George Floyd died of a fentanyl overdose.”
label: false
justification: In an August deposition in a workplace discrimination lawsuit, Hennepin County prosecutor Amy Sweasy Tamburino claimed that Hennepin County’s medical examiner told her in 2020, prior to releasing his findings, that he found no evidence of asphyxia or strangulation during George Floyd’s autopsy.The medical examiner’s final autopsy report concluded that Floyd’s death was a homicide caused by "cardiopulmonary arrest complicating law enforcement subdual, restraint, and neck compression," not a fentanyl overdose.Sweasy’s deposition transcript revealed no new information that would prove Floyd died of a fentanyl overdose.

statement: U.S. Rep. Mike Johnson is the 45th speaker of the House.
label: false
justification: U.S. Rep. Mike Johnson is the 56th speaker of the House.Then-Rep. John McCormack, D-Mass., was the 45th speaker of the House

statement: Irán izó una bandera negra y “esto significa un llamado” a la guerra o venganza.
label: false
justification: El Santuario Razavi también conocido como el Santuario de Imam Reza en Irán izó una bandera negra en luto después de la explosion de un hospital en Gaza.No es poco común que el santuario alce una bandera negra en luto.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: “Fallecimiento del exmandatario de la presidencia de Honduras" en incendio de cárcel en Nueva York.
label: false
justification: El expresidente de Honduras, Juan Orlando Hernández, el cual enfrenta cargos de tráfico de drogas y armas no falleció en una cárcel en Nueva York.PolitiFact no encontró reportes verídicos de medios que confirmen su muerte o de un incendio reciente en el Metropolitan Detention Center, donde Hernández espera su juicio.PolitiFact verificó en el sistema de presos del Federal Bureau of Prisons y encontró un recluso en el Metropolitan Detention Center con el mismo nombre, edad y raza que Hernández.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Video muestra “momento cuando el huracán Otis llegó a Acapulco”.
label: false
justification: Un video en Facebook no muestra imágenes del huracán Otis en México, los eventos en el video sucedieron en China en julio.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Video shows Elon Musk said South Africans no longer have to work with access to his “platform.”
label: false
justification: This video was altered.

statement: Video shows singer Kelly Clarkson discussing a “weight loss formula.”
label: false
justification: This video was altered.

statement: “Palestinian journalist films the moment an Israeli strike kills him and a fellow medic on live TV” in October 2023.
label: false
justification: This video is from 2014.

statement: Rainbow fentanyl is a threat to children on Halloween.
label: false
justification: Drug policy experts have repeatedly told news outlets that there have been no reports of fentanyl contaminating Halloween candy, and the risk of this happening is low.In August 2022, the U.S. Drug Enforcement Agency issued a warning about drug cartels disguising fentanyl in brightly colored pills and chalklike blocks to target young people. This report did not mention Halloween candy and an agency spokesperson has said it has no reason to believe this is a credible threat.

statement: “In UCLA hundreds of students chanting: ‘Israel Israel you can’t hide, we want Jewish genocide.’”
label: false
justification: Protesters chanted, "We charge you with genocide," not "We want Jewish genocide."

statement: The media didn’t cover “new history” when North Korea and South Korea’s leaders crossed the border for the first time.
label: false
justification: This meeting is from 2018 and was widely covered in the media.

statement: “Joe Biden confirms WW3 live on TV.”
label: false
justification: President Joe Biden urged aid for Israel and Ukraine in a recent primetime address; he didn’t declare World War III.

statement: Un nuevo subsidio del gobierno ofrece una tarjeta de salud con $1,200 al mes y “puedes usar el dinero para todo lo que desees o necesites".
label: false
justification: No es cierto que haya un subsidio nuevo que ofrezca tarjetas de salud mensuales con $1,200 para gastar en "todo lo que desees o necesites".Medicare Advantage ofrece tarjetas de débito, conocidas como "flex cards" que se pueden usar para comida, medicamentos, y copagos de atención odontológica, auditiva y oftalmológica.Pero estas "flex cards" empezaron en 2020 y tienen restricciones.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Photos show Gaza on Oct. 27.
label: false
justification: None of these photos were taken on Oct. 27. One was taken in 2019.

statement: Russian President Vladimir Putin suffered a heart attack Oct. 22, 2023.
label: false
justification: The Kremlin denied Russian President Vladimir Putin was ill. Photos released by Russian media show Putin at meetings and public events in the days after this supposed health emergency.The claim started on Telegram, a platform known for facilitating the spread of misinformation about Russia. The account that made the claim has shared other dubious reports about Putin’s health in the past.

statement: “Haaretz investigation reveals discrepancies in Israel’s reporting on October 7th death toll.”
label: false
justification: Haaretz, an Israeli newspaper, said on X that these claims about its reporting are "blatant lies."Haaretz and other news organizations have reported that during an Oct. 7 attack in Israel, Hamas killed about 1,300 people.

statement: “The airport in Salzburg, Austria, has a counter for people who flew to Austria instead of Australia.”
label: false
justification: This rumor stems from an ad. No such counter exists, according to the airport.

statement: Video shows Palestinians pretending to be corpses amid the Israel-Hamas war.
label: false
justification: This video is 10 years old and shows student protesters in Egypt, not Palestinians pretending to be dead amid the Israel-Hamas war.

statement: The life span of a wind tower generator lasts just three to four years.
label: false
justification: A study by energy industry experts showed that an average wind turbine generator lasts around 25 to 75 years.A spokesperson for the wind farm mentioned in the post said its wind turbine generators are expected to last around 20 years. ​

statement: Matthew Perry died because of a COVID-19 vaccine.
label: false
justification: Actor Matthew Perry died Oct. 28, but his cause of death is still under investigation. Social media claims suggesting he died because he received a COVID-19 vaccine lack evidence.

statement: A discrepancy in the number of ballots and voters in the 2022 general election in New York “appears to be a federal crime.”
label: false
justification: New York Citizens Audit is comparing certified election results to a voter file that was not complete.A difference in the number of votes in a certified election result and the number of voters who voted, according to their voter history in a different data set, is not evidence of a federal crime.

statement: “The FDA is required to take the COVID vaccines off the market” because they are “adulterated.”
label: false
justification: Experts said there’s no evidence that the mRNA COVID-19 vaccines are adulterated or contain ingredients that weren’t disclosed to regulators.Drug manufacturers and experts say that noninfectious parts of the SV40 virus’ DNA sequence are used to create COVID-19 vaccines, but that is normal in the pharmaceutical industry and is not considered a contaminant.

statement: McDonald’s changed its food wrappers to support Israel amid the war.
label: false
justification: McDonald’s didn’t introduce blue-and-white food wrappers to support Israel, the company said.They’re generic wrappers that come in a variety of colors that have been used for years for special orders, limited-edition products and supply shortages.The wrappers aren’t a political statement, according to McDonald’s.

statement: "Estados Unidos le cancelara el Parole a los venezolanos".
label: false
justification: Estados Unidos no ha cancelado el programa de parole humanitario para venezolanos.Aparte, la administración de Biden extendió un programa que previene la deportación de venezolanos que llegaron a Estados Unidos antes del 1 de agosto de 2023.En octubre se reanudaron los vuelos de deportación a Venezuela y los oficiales de inmigraicón dicen que los venezolanos que cruzan la frontera sur estadounidense ilegalmente pueden ser deportados.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: U.S. Sen. Chuck Schumer “is a dual Israeli citizen.”
label: false
justification: Sen. Chuck Schumer, D-N.Y., an American citizen, is one of 10 senators who are Jewish.Schumer doesn’t have dual citizenship with Israel, his spokesperson told PolitiFact.U.S. senators must be U.S. citizens for nine years to hold office, according toArticle I of the Constitution.

statement: "95% of over-the-counter pharmaceuticals" in the U.S. come from China.
label: false
justification: Entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy’s 95% figure matches what a 2019 Politico article said about ibuprofen, but the percentages for other medicines were smaller.The article’s percentages are out of scale with at least three other analyses. The other studies found China’s share of U.S. pharmaceutical ingredient imports range from about 20% down to the low single digits.Read more aboutPolitiFact’s fact-checking process and rating system.

statement: A video proves that the United Nations is “setting up shop in U.S. states.”
label: false
justification: The video was first posted in 2017. It shows United Nations peacekeeping vehicles manufactured in the U.S. and stored at a State Department warehouse in Hagerstown, Maryland, before they are shipped overseas.A State Department spokesperson told PolitiFact that the vehicles were used exclusively in U.N. peace operations abroad.

statement: Video shows protesters attacking Israel’s embassy in Bahrain with molotov cocktails.
label: false
justification: This footage has been online for more than a decade and shows protesters outside a police station in Bahrain.

statement: Video shows protesters in Lebanon “storming the border with Palestine in support of Gaza” in October 2023.
label: false
justification: This video is from 2021 and shows Lebanese protesters demonstrating at the country’s southern border with Israel.

statement: Photo shows President Joe Biden lounging on the beach in October 2023 amid the Israel-Hamas war.
label: false
justification: A photo of President Joe Biden on the beach in Delaware was taken in August.He recently visited his Delaware home and was filmed walking on the beach.

statement: Greta Thunberg urged people to use “vegan grenades” because “no animals should have to give their life for all this mayhem and chaos.”
label: false
justification: This video was altered.

statement: Writer Bari Weiss wrote that what the Trump administration did “was pretty incredible in hindsight.”
label: false
justification: Writer Bari Weiss was quoting someone else when she co-wrote in a recent story that what the Trump administration "did was pretty incredible in hindsight."

statement: Este video muestra al "Presidente Joe Biden llegando a Israel" con aviones escoltas.
label: false
justification: El Presidente Joe Biden visitó Israel el 18 de octubre.Pero, un video en Facebook no muestra imágenes reales del avión presidencial con escoltas, ya que estas fueron creadas por un videojuego de simulación.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Jim Justice “supports banning sporting rifles for law-abiding citizens.”
label: false
justification: Mooney’s statement cherry picks and exaggerates a comment Justice made in a 2022 briefing. In the briefing, Justice expressed doubts that 18-year-olds should be able to buy assault weapons, suggesting the minimum age should be raised to 21.This has not become law during his tenure, and even if it had, Mooney’s phrasing makes Justice’s statement sound more far-reaching than it is. "Sporting rifle" is a broader category than "assault weapon."Justice signed a bill expanding concealed-carry rights on the state’s college campuses, and his campaign website says he is against "more gun control and confiscation."Learn more aboutPolitiFact’s fact-checking process and rating system.

statement: Video shows crisis actors in Palestine “working overtime to fool the world” during the current Israel-Hamas war.
label: false
justification: This footage was originally uploaded to YouTube in 2017 and shows behind-the-scenes moments from a film project.

statement: Video shows University of Pennsylvania students chanting, “We want Jewish genocide.”
label: false
justification: Penn Students Against the Occupation, which organized an Oct. 16 rally on the University of Pennsylvania campus, said protesters chanted, "Israel, Israel you can’t hide, we charge you with genocide." The student newspaper corroborated this.

statement: Las empresas solares en Estados Unidos "tienen que regalar paneles solares sin costo neto si lo solicitas".
label: false
justification: Una portavoz del Departamento de Energía de los Estados Unidos le dijo a PolitiFact que las compañías solares no están requeridas a regalar paneles solares.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Black flag hoisted over a mosque in Iran is a “call to all of Islam for war.”
label: false
justification: The Imam Reza shrine in Iran hoisted a black flag in mourning after the explosion at a Gaza hospital.It’s not uncommon for the shrine to hoist a black flag in mourning.

statement: Video shows Russia attacking Israel in October 2023.
label: false
justification: This video has been online for at least a year and shows a pilot with a U.S. Air Force badge flying a plane. We found no credible evidence that Russia has attacked Israel.

statement: Video shows CNN interviewing “actors.”
label: false
justification: Claims this interview shows crisis actors pretending their parents were killed by Hamas attackers are unfounded.

statement: "AHORA: Manifestantes pro palestinos y policías se enfrentaron en las calles de Barcelona, ​​España. Las protestas son parte de represalias después del bombardeo de un hospital en Gaza".
label: false
justification: El video fue grabado en octubre de 2020, y los disturbios formaban parte de una manifestación en contra de las medidas de restricciones por la pandemia de COVID-19.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Video shows North Korean President Kim Jong Un blaming President Joe Biden for the Israel-Hamas war and Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, and saying, “I support Donald Trump for President in 2024.”
label: false
justification: On Oct. 10, 2020, at a military parade, North Korea leader Kim Jong Un delivered a speech warning that his nation would use nuclear power if provoked and thanking his people for overcoming hardships such as the coronavirus pandemic.A translated version of Kim’s speech did not include the words, "Biden," "Trump," "Israel," "Palestine," "Russia," "Ukraine," or "Taliban." Russia’s February 2022 invasion of Ukraine and Hamas’ Oct. 7 attack on Israel had not yet happened.Kim mentioned that international sanctions had created challenges for North Koreans, but he did not call out the U.S. specifically in his Oct. 10, 2020, speech, according to news reports.

statement: A video shows “a car carrying men waving the Palestinian flag abruptly and dangerously stopping traffic to run ‘donuts.’”
label: false
justification: The car was waving a Puerto Rican flag, not a Palestinian flag.

statement: “Nikki Haley argues in support of bringing Gaza refugees to America.”
label: false
justification: During an Oct. 15 CNN interview, Nikki Haley was asked whether the U.S. and other countries should help Palestinians displaced by the Israel-Hamas war. Haley said the U.S. should care about innocent civilians, but added that Arab countries were unwilling to take them.Haley also said many people in Gaza want to be free from terrorist rule. "And America's always been sympathetic to the fact that you can separate civilians from terrorists. And that's what we have to do."Haley did not call for allowing refugees from Gaza into the U.S.

statement: Joe Biden advirtió el 15 de octubre de 2023 “que Corea del Norte podría estar preparando un ataque parecido al Hamas en Israel pero este sería en suelo americano”.
label: false
justification: PolitiFact no encontró ningún discurso ni reporte verídico que diga que Biden advirtió el 15 de octubre sobre un ataque de Corea del Norte a Estados Unidos. En vez, esta preocupación vino de parte de Corea del Sur.El Ministro de Defensa de Corea del Sur dijo el 10 de octubre tener preocupación de que Corea del Norte ataque sorpresivamente a Corea del Sur, como los militantes de Hamas a Israel, según The Associated Press.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Video shows a family learning their debt was resolved by the “American Debt Relief program” for American citizens and legal residents who “have over $20,000” in credit card debt.
label: false
justification: This video clip appears to have originated on the TikTok account of a prospective Tulane University student receiving word in 2019 that she had been accepted.There is no federal program called the "American Debt Relief program" available to Americans who have more than $20,000 in credit card debt. The video directs viewers to a private debt settlement company.

statement: “A partir de ahora la milicia de Hamas se vio obligada a rendirse al ejército Israeli, ondeando sus banderas blancas".
label: false
justification: No hay reportes creíbles de que los líderes de Hamas se hayan rendido a las tropas israelíes.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: The Wall Street Journal reported that the Oct. 17 Gaza hospital explosion was caused by an American missile.
label: false
justification: The Wall Street Journal said it published no such report.We found no evidence that any other credible news source reported that the hospital explosion was caused by an American missile.

statement: Benjamin Netanyahu dijo que lanzará una bomba nuclear a Gaza.
label: false
justification: El primer ministro de Israel, Benjamin Netanyahu, no dijo que iba a lanzar una bomba nuclear a Gaza, los subtítulos en español fueron manipulados.PolitiFact tradujo el discurso completo y él no mencionó una bomba nuclear.Un vocero del ministro de relaciones exteriores de Israel le confirmó a The Associated Press que la traducción en los subtítulos del video en Facebook es "falsa".Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: “Thousands of U.S. troops make their way to Israel” in video.
label: false
justification: This footage predates the current conflict between Israel and Hamas. Some of the video clips were taken in Djibouti, which is more than 1,400 miles from Israel, in 2018.

statement: Video shows “Egyptians delivering food and water to Gaza” in October 2023.
label: false
justification: This video predates the Israel-Hamas war that started in October.

statement: President Joe Biden declared a federal emergency and deployed the National Guard in October.
label: false
justification: This video is about an emergency declaration in Vermont after heavy rains and flooding in July; we found no evidence that President Joe Biden declared a national emergency in October and deployed the National Guard as a result.

statement: A video shows President Joe Biden invoking the Selective Service Act.
label: false
justification: This video of President Joe Biden announcing that he is invoking the Selective Service Act for a military draft was generated by artificial intelligence. It was first uploaded in February.

statement: Este video muestra “la franja de Gaza” en llamas.
label: false
justification: Las imágenes al principio del video fueron publicadas días antes del ataque de Hamas en contra de Israel. Las imágenes fueron tomadas en Algeria, no Gaza.En otras imágenes se ven establecimientos incendiados, pero eso pasó en un mercado en Masalli, Azerbaiyán, el 6 de octubre.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: “Egypt is now at war with Israel.”
label: false
justification: There have been no credible news reports or government declarations that Egypt is now at war with Israel.

statement: “Cries of Victory in Israel — Gaza Now Belongs to Israel! HAMAS Surrenders Desperately!”
label: false
justification: Israel has yet to launch an expected ground invasion into Gaza in response to an Oct. 7 terrorist attack by Hamas militants.There are no credible reports that Hamas leaders have surrendered.

statement: A debit card issued by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees is being used to pay for a U.S. invasion.
label: false
justification: The United Nations refugee agency uses the card shown in the video to give humanitarian cash assistance to certain asylum seekers in Mexico, including children at risk of abuse and exploitation, single mothers, gender-violence survivors and people with medical needs.To get this cash assistance, people must express their will to remain in Mexico and register for it. According to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, less than 10% of people who seek asylum in Mexico receive this assistance.Based on the refugee agency’s monitoring, most people use this help to pay rent or buy food.

statement: Video shows an “inflatable decoy plane” at the Kabul airport in 2021.
label: false
justification: A cargo plane captured on video at the airport in Kabul, Afghanistan, as U.S. military personnel evacuated people from the country is real.

statement: A video shows red flares and fireworks going off in Gaza.
label: false
justification: The video was uploaded days before the Hamas attacks against Israel, and was taken in Algeria, not Gaza.

statement: "‎The emir of Qatar, Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad al-Thani, has threatened that if the bombing of Gaza does not stop, he will cut off the supply of gas to the world.”
label: false
justification: Qatar’s emir hasn’t threatened to cut off the world’s gas supply if the bombing of Gaza doesn’t stop. The country’s government has tried to mediate in the Israel-Hamas war, but has made no such threat.

statement: "La Esfera de Las Vegas se ilumina con la bandera de Israel”.
label: false
justification: La imagen fue alterada.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: The Las Vegas Sphere displayed an Israeli flag.
label: false
justification: This image was altered, the venue said.

statement: Video shows recent violence in Israel and Gaza is “fake.”
label: false
justification: This video has been online since at least 2020.

statement: A CNN reporter “faked” being near the Israel-Gaza border.
label: false
justification: Clarissa Ward, CNN’s chief international correspondent, was near the Israel-Gaza border in a recent broadcast and was still in Israel several days later, according to CNN.

statement: Video shows U.S. Navy pilots arriving in Palestine.
label: false
justification: This video doesn’t show U.S. Navy pilots arriving in Palestine, according to the Pentagon.

statement: "Estados Unidos lanza el primer ataque hacia Medio Oriente" después del ataque de Hamas a Israel.
label: false
justification: Un video en Facebook dice que Estados Unidos lanzó su primer ataque hacia el Medio Oriente después del ataque de Hamas a Israel, pero no hay evidencia verídica de esto.El video fue creado originalmente por una cuenta satírica en TikTok, la cual usó imágenes ficticias de un video juego.​​Un vocero de la Oficina del Secretario de Defensa de los Estados Unidos le dijo a PolitiFact el 12 de octubre que el video es falso.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Video muestra "camión de la ONU traficando con niños” en Senegal.
label: false
justification: Un video en Facebook no muestra niños siendo traficados en Senegal por la Organización de las Naciones Unidas.El video fue publicado por medios en Zimbabue en el 2019 cuando un guardia de seguridad de una compañía privada fue confundido por ser secuestrador de niños al transportar a los hijos de su jefe.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Este video muestra un "contraataque israelí" hacia Hamas en Gaza.
label: false
justification: Una publicación en Facebook no muestra un contraataque israelí contra el grupo Hamas actualmente, sino que muestra una casa en Gaza siendo bombardeada en mayo.En mayo, aviones de guerra israelíes bombardearon objetivos del grupo militante Yihad Islámica Palestina en la Franja de Gaza.El grupo militante, el segundo grupo guerrillero más grande después de Hamas, disparó proyectiles hacia Jerusalem y el sur de Israel, según The Associated Press.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Video shows CNN “faking attack in Israel on the camera.”
label: false
justification: This video was altered.

statement: Video shows the Secret Service failing to protect Kamala Harris after she became vice president.
label: false
justification: Vice President Kamala Harris was a U.S. senator from California when a protester confronted her at a 2019 event.

statement: "Sadly, American taxpayer dollars helped fund these attacks, which many reports are saying came from the Biden administration.”
label: false
justification: Trump appears to be referring to $6 billion in Iranian money unfrozen as part of a hostage deal struck between the Biden administration and Iran.However, no taxpayer dollars were included in that $6 billion; it was entirely money that South Korea paid to Iran for oil. Amid sanctions, banks froze the funds, preventing them from reaching Iranian coffers.One school of thought says that access to these funds could one day allow Iran to spend money on other things, including aid to Hamas. But strictly speaking, none of the money from the $6 billion agreement went to "fund" the Hamas attacks, because none of it had been withdrawn, for any purpose.

statement: Un video muestra cómo la "Fuerza aérea de Israel ataca Gaza" en octubre de 2023.
label: false
justification: Este video es de mayo de 2023.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: Russian President Vladimir Putin “warns ‘global terrorist’ Klaus Schwab his ‘days are numbered.’”
label: false
justification: Russian President Vladimir Putin didn’t say this.

statement: Video shows Israel’s Iron Dome intercepting rockets Hamas fired in October 2023.
label: false
justification: This video is from May 2021.

statement: Magnetic “lymphatic earrings” aid weight loss.
label: pants-fire
justification: Health experts say there’s no evidence that wearing magnetic jewelry or earrings that stimulate acupressure points will prompt significant weight loss.Drinking water, eating a balanced diet and exercising regularly can promote a healthy lifestyle.

statement: “In every single war that America has fought, we have never asked for land afterwards, except for enough to bury the Americans who gave the ultimate sacrifice for that freedom we went in for.”
label: pants-fire
justification: • Former House Speaker Kevin McCarthy’s assertion is undercut by two centuries of U.S. history, including land gains following wars against Mexico, Spain, Filipino rebels, Japan and Native American tribes.

statement: Princess Diana “is still alive” and “possibly could be with Trump.”
label: pants-fire
justification: Princess Diana died in August 1997.

statement: Video shows first lady Jill Biden calling President Joe Biden “the world's biggest cheerleader for the atrocities happening now in Gaza."
label: pants-fire
justification: This video was altered.

statement: A “B-2 stealth bomber seen over New York” means “Hezbollah may declare war on Israel.”
label: pants-fire
justification: A B-2 Spirit Stealth Bomber flew over Ulster County, New York, on Nov. 2, but it was related to a football game — not to war in the Middle East.

statement: “Jews did 9/11.”
label: pants-fire
justification: Al-Qaida terrorists were responsible for the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks, not ‘Jews’ or Israel.

statement: Joe Rogan spoke about a child being abducted into a secret Disneyland tunnel.
label: pants-fire
justification: There’s no evidence that Joe Rogan spoke on his podcast about an Oct. 13 child abduction at California’s Disneyland, as an Instagram video claimed.Anaheim, California, police said they are not investigating a child abduction at the park and called the video’s claim unfounded.Rogan has not worn the T-shirt he is seen wearing in the video in any podcast in October or November. Our review found he last wore the shirt for a show that aired in March.

statement: Video shows someone wearing a Donald Trump mask appeared in court instead of the former president.
label: pants-fire
justification: Former President Donald Trump’s face is distorted in an altered video of his civil fraud trial in New York. Original footage shows what he really looked like — himself.

statement: "Acapulco destroyed by yet another directed weather attack!”
label: pants-fire
justification: Hurricane Otis stunned weather forecasters with winds that rapidly intensified in the 24 hours before it struck Acapulco, a Mexican resort city.Such rapid intensification is becoming more common because of warming oceans, a recent study showed.There are weather modification programs in use, but none that could intensify a hurricane or direct it on a path, experts said.

statement: Wisconsin elections administrator Meagan Wolfe “refuses to clean up our voter rolls”
label: pants-fire
justification: A TV ad claimed Wisconsin Elections Commission administrator Meagan Wolfe refused to "clean up" Wisconsin’s voter rolls.The impeachment articles against Wolfe at the heart of the ad falsely claim Wisconsin has more registered voters than residents.The articles included inactive voters in with eligible, active registered voters to reach the incorrect count.Neither Wolfe nor state elections commissioners are responsible for removing names from Wisconsin’s voter roll.

statement: Wisconsin elections administrator Meagan Wolfe “permitted the ‘Zuckerbucks’ influence money.”
label: pants-fire
justification: A television ad claimed Wisconsin Elections Commission Administrator Meagan Wolfe permitted outside funding from a group backed by Meta founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg in the 2020 elections.The ad misrepresents Wolfe’s role as elections administrator.Local clerks, not Wolfe, accepted grants from Zuckerberg’s group to help manage voting challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic.State and federal judges ruled the grants were legal on multiple occasions.

statement: “NASA admits space and planets are fake.”
label: pants-fire
justification: NASA didn’t say space and planets are fake.

statement: Video shows someone impersonating President Joe Biden visiting Israel in October 2023.
label: pants-fire
justification: Video shows President Joe Biden in Israel, not an impersonator.

statement: Photos are evidence actor Courteney Cox uses adrenochrome from kidnapped children.
label: pants-fire
justification: Claims that celebrities use adrenochrome harvested from children to stay young are unfounded and stem from the QAnon movement.The supposed photo of actor Courteney Cox appearing old after she went without adrenochrome shows Cox using a photo filter designed to make her look older.

statement: “Dr. Fauci doesn’t exist!”
label: pants-fire
justification: This claim is unfounded.

statement: “Every President we ever had in the United States of America was a draconian reptilian.”
label: pants-fire
justification: Claims that politicians are reptilian are part of an unfounded and long-standing conspiracy theory.

statement: Video shows a President Joe Biden impostor.
label: pants-fire
justification: Claims that video footage shows a President Joe Biden impostor are unfounded.

statement: Este video muestra al Dr. Juan Rivera hablando sobre un medicamento para la artritis y la artrosis.
label: pants-fire
justification: El video del Dr. Juan Rivera no es legítimo.La artritis y la artrosis son dos patologías de las articulaciones que no tienen cura, aunque sí hay tratamientos para tratarlos.Si ves algo que te hace preguntar: ¿es cierto?Mándanoslo por WhatsApp y nuestro equipo lo investigará, (813) 260-7595.

statement: The Democrats are pushing “to take in a million Palestinian refugees.”
label: pants-fire
justification: The Democratic comments about refugees so far fall well short of what Biggs and other conservatives have described.Rep. Jaamal Bowman, D-N.Y., said "the international community as well as the United States should be prepared to welcome refugees from Palestine while being very careful to vet and not allow members of Hamas."Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., said the U.S. has a "historic role" in accepting refugees.

statement: “There isn't a single video or photo suggesting that 250 people were killed (by Hamas) at a concert or that a mass shooting took place” on Oct. 7 in Israel.
label: pants-fire
justification: The Oct. 7 Hamas attack at the Tribe of Nova music festival that killed 260 people was well documented by the media and confirmed by world leaders.Reports were substantiated by images and videos of shootings at the festival grounds.

statement: Less than 48 hours after Israel was attacked “we have hundreds of hours worth of footage but zero footage from the Ukraine war.”
label: pants-fire
justification: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has been well documented by news outlets and Ukrainian civilians.

statement: The 2023 Israel-Hamas war is a “false flag.”
label: pants-fire
justification: False flag operations have happened for generations, but in recent history, actual false flags are outnumbered by dubious conspiracy theories.Experts have warned that social media rumors alleging "false flags" should be viewed skeptically. We found no credible evidence that the current Israel-Hamas war is one.

statement: “Kamala Harris is not a ‘natural born citizen’” and “can’t be president.”
label: pants-fire
justification: Vice President Kamala Harris is a natural-born U.S. citizen and eligible for the presidency.

statement: “The same people that raided Israel are pouring into our once beautiful USA, through our TOTALLY OPEN SOUTHERN BORDER, at Record Numbers.”
label: pants-fire
justification: A central tenet of Hamas, which is classified as a terrorist group by the U.S. State Department, is to destroy Israel.Terrorism experts say there is no proof that Hamas militants have been "pouring" across the U.S. southern border, and the Department of Homeland Security said there's no intelligence to back up the claim.People aren’t crossing the southern border to conduct terrorist attacks or take over parts of the United States, an expert told us. A small percentage may commit crimes, such as selling drugs, but most come for jobs and political freedom.

statement: Video shows President Joe Biden telling a child, “You’re one sexy kid.”
label: pants-fire
justification: This video was altered

statement: Former President Donald Trump is commander in chief.
label: pants-fire
justification: Former President Donald Trump isn’t the commander in chief.

statement: “Trump controls U.S. military.”
label: pants-fire
justification: Former President Donald Trump doesn’t control the military.

statement: California Gov. Gavin Newsom is “not human.”
label: pants-fire
justification: California Gov. Gavin Newsom is a human.

statement: Patent shows 5G towers are used for brainwashing.
label: pants-fire
justification: U.S. patent No. 5356368A is not related to 5G towers. It’s for a meditation aid by the Monroe Institute, a nonprofit organization, according to a Monroe Institute spokesperson.

statement: A fact-check proves Michelle Obama is “a he.”
label: pants-fire
justification: Former first lady Michelle Obama is not a man.

statement: A video shows children disappearing from inside a school bus.
label: pants-fire
